question: Where did Maisie live?
answer1: in an old farmhouse which stood by a river

question: Who was tall and straight, with auburn hair and blue eyes, and she was the prettiest girl in all the valley?
answer1: Maisie

question: Why did her mother use to sigh and shake her head whenever she looked at Maisie?
answer1: Maisie was not a good spinster.
answer2: Maisie was not good at spinning thread.

question: What did men look for in girls to be their wives?
answer1: girls who could cook and spin, and who gave promise of becoming notable housewives

question: Why was the mother disappointed in her daughter?
answer1: Her daughter did not take after her.

question: What did Maisie love to do instead of sitting at her spinning-wheel?
answer1: be out of doors, chasing butterflies and plucking wild flowers

question: Why was her mother getting frustrated at Maisie when she saw her companions?
answer1: Her mother saw one after another of Maisie's companions, who were not nearly so pretty as she was, getting rich husbands.

question: What did Maisie's mother want her to do because she would not marry?
answer1: learn to be a nun

question: How did Maisie's mother feel when she did not care about getting married?
answer1: angry

question: What did Maisie do after her mother wanted her to become a nun?
answer1: tried not to think of the sunshine outside, but sat down soberly with her distaff

question: How did Maisie feel when her mother decided she needed to go to the nunnery?
answer1: sad

question: Why did Maisie start sitting at her spinning-wheel?
answer1: She did not want to go to the nunnery.
answer2: She did not want her mother to send her to the nunnery.

question: Why did Maisie make slow progress at her spinning-wheel?
answer1: She was so little accustomed to work.

question: How much yarn did Maisie spin?
answer1: half a hank of yarn

question: Why did Maisie work slowly the next day?
answer1: Her arms ached so much.

question: How did Maisie feel about spinning all day?
answer1: frustrated

question: What will Maisie do when she was tired of spinning yarn?
answer1: throw down her distaff in despair, and run out of doors

question: Where did Maisie go to after she wanted a break from spinning yarn?
answer1: a deep dell

question: Why wasn't the poor girl in the mood that morning to enjoy the flowers and the birds?
answer1: She could not spin yarn well.
answer2: She did not want to go to the nunnery.

question: What did Maisie do instead of watching the flowers and the birds?
answer1: hid her face in her hands, and wondered what would become of her

question: How did Maisie feel when she heard a queer,cracked voice quite close to her?
answer1: scared

question: What did Maisie see sitting on the boulder?
answer1: the queerest little old woman that she had ever seen in her life

question: Why did the old Dame help Maisie?
answer1: She did not like to see pretty girls weep.

question: What will happen after Maisie fails to spin yarn well?
answer1: She will meet someone who will spin yarn for her.

question: What will Maisie's new friend tell her to do?
answer1: run home and fetch the lint

question: What happened after Maisie handed the flint to the little lady?
answer1: The old woman had vanished entirely.

question: Why was Maisie utterly bewildered?
answer1: The old woman was nowhere to be seen.

question: How did Maisie know that she was not dreaming?
answer1: She saw her footprints.
answer2: She saw her foot mark on a stone.

question: Why was Maisie worried that her flint was gone?
answer1: She did not finish her task and she had to tell her mother she lost her lint.
answer2: She did not want to tell her mother she lost the lint

question: Who was the little old woman?
answer1: Habetrot

question: What will Maisie do when the little old woman disappears?
answer1: run up and down the little dell, hunting amongst the bushes, and peeping into every nook the little dell, hunting amongst the bushes, and peeping into every nook herself

question: Where did the little old woman hide?
answer1: in the ground

question: Who were seated on large white stones, and they were all spinning away as fast as they could?
answer1: little old women

question: What did Habetrot ask Maisie to do after she finished spinning the thread?
answer1: not tell her mother who spun the thread for her

question: How many black puddings did Maisie eat?
answer1: seven

question: Why did Maisie eat all of the black puddings?
answer1: She was very hungry, and that fried black puddings were very good.

question: How did Maisie feel when Habetrot completed spinning the thread?
answer1: happy

question: What will happen when her mother sees the thread?
answer1: She will be surprised.

question: What did Maisie's mother think about?
answer1: her daughter's careless ways, and had been sorrowfully making up her mind that she must lose no time in speaking to the Abbess of St. Mary's about this idle girl of hers

question: What will Maisie's mother see on the table when she wakes up?
answer1: seven beautiful hanks of thread

question: Where did the very rich young nobleman live?
answer1: a beautiful Castle

question: What did the rich young nobleman want to do instead of marrying any country girl?
answer1: go away to London Town and marry a Duke's daughter

question: Why did the rich young nobleman take his horse to the smithy himself?
answer1: This young nobleman's favourite horse had lost a shoe, and he was so afraid that any of the grooms might ride it along the hard road, and not on the soft grass at this side.

question: Why did the rich young nobleman stop his horse?
answer1: Maisie's mother sang a stange song.

question: How did Maisie's mother feel when she saw Maisie's thread?
answer1: happy

question: What did Maisie's mother do when the rich young nobleman asked why she sang such a strange song?
answer1: made no answer, but turned and walked into the house

question: What did Maisie's mother show to the rich young nobleman?
answer1: Maisie's thread

question: Why did the rich young nobleman ask to see Maisie?
answer1: He was impressed by her spinning skills.

question: Why did the rich young nobleman want to marry Maisie?
answer1: She was both pretty and useful.

question: Why was Maisie afraid that she would be expected to spin a great deal at the Castle?
answer1: Her husband was sure to find out that she was not really such a good spinstress as he thought she was.

question: Why was Maisie's mother overjoyed that she received a proposal?
answer1: She was worried about finding a husband for her daughter.
answer2: She was worried that her daughter would never get married.

question: Why did the rich young nobleman fall in love with her on the spot?
answer1: She was very beautiful.

question: How did Maisie's mother feel when the rich young nobleman proposed?
answer1: overjoyed

question: What will Maisie do before she gets married?
answer1: She will find Habetrot.
answer2: She will ask for Habetrot's help.

question: Where did Maisie go to the night before her wedding?
answer1: to the great boulder by the stream in the glen

question: What did the Habetrot tell Maisie to do?
answer1: come here with thy bridegroom next week, when the moon is full

question: How did Maisie convince her husband to go to the great boulder when the moon was full?
answer1: suggested to her husband that they should take a walk together in the moonlight

question: How did Maisie feel when she was waiting for the little Fairy to help her?
answer1: anxious

question: What did the prince want Maisie to do?
answer1: use the beautiful new spinning wheel
answer2: use the gift he got her

question: How did Maisie make the little old woman appear?
answer1: put her head against it and whispered, "Habetrot, dear Habetrot"

question: Why did Habetrot treat the two as if they were both strangers to her?
answer1: She needed to trick the Prince.
answer2: She could not reveal that she made Maisie's thread.

question: Why was the Prince very startled and surprised by the little old women?
answer1: They were very ugly.

question: Where did Habetrot lead the Prince and Maisie?
answer1: the other valley which Maisie had seen through the hole in the great stone

question: Who seemed far uglier than they had seemed at first?
answer1: the little old women

question: What did Maisie notice about the little old women?
answer1: they now wore caps and dresses of dull grey, and instead of looking happy, they all seemed to be trying who could look most miserable

question: What did one of the little old women do when the Prince tried to talk to her?
answer1: tried to tell him, but all the sound that he could hear was something that sounded like SPIN-N-N

question: What did the Prince do after one of the little old women tried to talk to him?
answer1: seized Maisie by the hand and hurried her through the green door
